original_solution_mapping.L1: Mark buys 6 $2 cans of soup, meaning he spends 6*2= <<6*2=12>>12 dollars on soup.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Mark buys 2 $5 loaves of bread, meaning he spends 2*5= <<2*5=10>>10 dollars on bread.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Mark buys 2 $3 boxes of cereal, meaning he spends 2*3= <<2*3=6>>6 dollars on cereal.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Mark buys 2 $4 gallons of milk, meaning he spends 2*4= <<2*4=8>>8 dollars on milk.
original_solution_mapping.L5: All added together, this means Mark spends 12+10+6+8= <<12+10+6+8=36>>36 dollars
original_solution_mapping.L6: Since Mark only has $10 bills, he spends 36/10= <<36/10=3.6>>3.6 tens on it, which rounds up to 4 as you cannot spend .6 of an undividable item.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4419.
    Returns: the number of $10 bills Mark needs to use.
    """
    # L1
    num_soup_cans = 6 # 6 2$ cans of soup
    cost_per_soup_can = 2 # 2$ cans of soup
    cost_soup = num_soup_cans * cost_per_soup_can

    # L2
    num_bread_loaves = 2 # 2 $5 loaves of bread
    cost_per_bread_loaf = 5 # $5 loaves of bread
    cost_bread = num_bread_loaves * cost_per_bread_loaf

    # L3
    num_cereal_boxes = 2 # 2 3$ boxes of cereal
    cost_per_cereal_box = 3 # 3$ boxes of cereal
    cost_cereal = num_cereal_boxes * cost_per_cereal_box

    # L4
    num_milk_gallons = 2 # 2 $4 gallons of milk
    cost_per_milk_gallon = 4 # $4 gallons of milk
    cost_milk = num_milk_gallons * cost_per_milk_gallon

    # L5
    total_spent = cost_soup + cost_bread + cost_cereal + cost_milk

    # L6
    bill_denomination = 10 # $10 bills
    intermediate_bills_float = total_spent / bill_denomination
    num_bills_needed = (total_spent + bill_denomination - 1) // bill_denomination

    # FA
    answer = num_bills_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Mark buys {num_soup_cans} ${cost_per_soup_can} cans of soup, meaning he spends {num_soup_cans}*{cost_per_soup_can}= <<{num_soup_cans}*{cost_per_soup_can}={cost_soup}>>{cost_soup} dollars on soup.

Mark buys {num_bread_loaves} ${cost_per_bread_loaf} loaves of bread, meaning he spends {num_bread_loaves}*{cost_per_bread_loaf}= <<{num_bread_loaves}*{cost_per_bread_loaf}={cost_bread}>>{cost_bread} dollars on bread.

Mark buys {num_cereal_boxes} ${cost_per_cereal_box} boxes of cereal, meaning he spends {num_cereal_boxes}*{cost_per_cereal_box}= <<{num_cereal_boxes}*{cost_per_cereal_box}={cost_cereal}>>{cost_cereal} dollars on cereal.

Mark buys {num_milk_gallons} ${cost_per_milk_gallon} gallons of milk, meaning he spends {num_milk_gallons}*{cost_per_milk_gallon}= <<{num_milk_gallons}*{cost_per_milk_gallon}={cost_milk}>>{cost_milk} dollars on milk.
All added together, this means Mark spends {cost_soup}+{cost_bread}+{cost_cereal}+{cost_milk}= <<{cost_soup}+{cost_bread}+{cost_cereal}+{cost_milk}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} dollars

Since Mark only has ${bill_denomination} bills, he spends {total_spent}/{bill_denomination}= <<{total_spent}/{bill_denomination}={intermediate_bills_float}>>{intermediate_bills_float} tens on it, which rounds up to {num_bills_needed} as you cannot spend .6 of an undividable item.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: Since Mark only has $10 bills, he spends 30/10= <<30/10=3>>3 tens on it, which rounds up to 3 as you cannot spend .6 of an undividable item.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_milk_gallons' (value: 2) was used instead of 'cost_milk' (value: 8).
